title: Big Chief - Face (1991)@flac
description:
Stoner grunge with a heavy funk groove from Michigan band. 
Loud-n-heavy guitar, bass, and drums. Grunge singer, plus cool r-n-b female backing vocals on some tracks. Big Chief seems to draw a wide influence from Zeppelin to Kyuss to rap to funk. Short spoken intros on some songs. Production and sound quality A-1. Released thru Caroline/Sub Pop. Disc loses a little steam after track 6, but overall way stronger than the Drive It Off release. 
If you are into bands like Mudhoney, Nebula, Kyuss, early Monster Magnet, maybe even Rage Against the Machine or Soundgarden, give this a listen. Rock On ! (Customer from Amazon)

 
http://i.imgur.com/JyfVRWK.jpg


01. Drive It Off    [3:34]
02. Now Who Gonna Do All That    [3:43]
03. Lie There And Be Good    [5:24]
04. Reduced To Tears    [5:43]
05. Bong Wrench    [4:08]
06. 500 Reasons    [4:02]
07. Fresh Vines    [3:50]
08. Desert Jam    [5:33]
09. Face    [4:34]
10. Honey-Legged    [4:10]
11. Strange Notes    [2:32]



Performer - Barry Henssler, Mark Dancey, Matty O, Mike Danner, Phil D.
Backing Vocals - Thornetta Davis, Sue Lott
Percussion - Mr. Scott Guy


Written-By - Big Chief
Producer - Al Sutton, Big Chief

The sleeve lists the tracks in a completely different order to that used on the release itself. 
Track 11 not listed. 


Label: Repulsion
Released: 1991 
Catalogue: RE 006 CD

Codec: Flac
Compression Level: 6
Quality: High


CD-rip by alekow (EAC and Flac)
Covers Included (600dpi)
